intro: Calorophus fasciculatus, commonly known as the clustered fireweed, is a flowering plant native to arctic and alpine regions. The plant thrives in nutrient-poor soils and is often found in tundra and rocky habitats. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Calorophus fasciculatus plays a vital role in stabilizing soil in extreme environments and supports local pollinator populations.
